alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Gila; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 7:04PM MST until July 19 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEAST GILA, SOUTHEAST COCONINO AND SOUTHWEST NAVAJO COUNTIES... At 658 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain had ended across the warned area in far northeast Gila, southeast Coconino, and southwest Navajo counties. This includes mainly rural areas. Between 1 and 2.25 inches fell earlier this evening. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Apache Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Crouch Creek, Ellison Creek, Gentry Creek, Canyon Creek, Pine Creek, Oak Creek, Chevelon Canyon, Bear Creek, Cherry Creek, Rock House Creek, Mule Creek, Willow Creek, Haigler Creek, Rock Creek and Sloan Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
